Posts.Content: May 30, 2011 11:02PM mommaof4 wrote: I just had my BMX withlymph node removal on the 24th of May but I have a couple of questions I thought could be best answered here.    How long before most of you could sleep on your side?  I am a side sleeper and have been sleeping in a rented recliner but it has gotten so uncomfortable that I am going to try my bed tonight with a wedge pillow.   Also, I came home with 4 drains, 2 on each side.  My lefy side (the side of the node removals) is sooo painful and numb...  Is the nubness/pain more from the surgery itself or from the drains still being in? Thank you- all of you women I read about on here are absolutely amazing!
Posts.Title: April 2011 Masectomy IllinoisNancy Beaglesgirl
Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2012 05:57PM mommaof4 wrote: Thank you for all the compliments!!    I am also a Latisse user.  My plastic surgeon at Northwestern did an internal study and 100% of users kept lashes and brows all throughout chemo and after.  I started using it about 4 weeks before starting chemo so my lashes and brows were super thick by the time they started thinning a little.  I did end up plucking my lashes out about 8 weeks after chemo ended because I had so many new ones coming in that my old lashes started going in all different directions and sticking in my eye... and I did lose most of my brows.  So I looked like I didn't have lashes and brows for maybe about 2 weeks.  Anyway, my lashes and brows are very thick again and my lashes are getting longer every day. I wish I could have made my pic larger...  I would definitely recommend Latisse as it made this whole horrible process much easier for me to handle :)
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: May 30, 2011 11:25PM mommaof4 wrote: I am a stage 0, grade 3 with multifocal areas and I had my BMX/lymph node removal 6 days ago.  I also thought the injections were horrible and painful.  I had two of them and they were equally sooo painful.  I feel almost angry that this was not discussed with me, creams or meds were not offered.   When I found out they were getting ready to do it and it was supposed to be so painful- I begged for some valium and my nurse just left the room, basically ignoring me saying it's best to just do it and get it over with.  I myself am a labor and delivery RN and this is just not acceptable!
Posts.Title: Radioactive Injection into Nipple NOT TERRIBLE waynesgirl50 Motherofall6

Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2011 10:36PM mommaof4 wrote: CorrineM1, where are you being treated in the chicago area? I am at Northwesren Univ Med Center. Long story short... my plastic surgeons office has been conducting an internal study on the effects of Latisse during chemo and so far has had a 100% sucess rate of pts keeping lashes and brows (we put it on our brows too) all through chemo and after. Latisse was even giving out free boxes to any chemo patients in the office, not sure if they still are? My ps is Dr John Kim, Northwestern. I personally just started chemo on Monday sooo... TCH every 21 days X 6 but I have high hopes about keeping my brows and lashes :)
